title: 109_s1647
content: The Act is titled the "Hurricane Katrina Bankruptcy Relief and Community Protection Act of 2005" and provides bankruptcy relief for victims of Hurricane Katrina. The "Hurricane Katrina Bankruptcy Relief and Community Protection Act of 2005" provides bankruptcy relief under title 11, United States Code, for cases commenced within 12 months of the Act's effective date by debtors affected by Hurricane Katrina. SEC. 3. DEFINITIONS; WHO MAY BE A DEBTOR. The amendment to Section 101 of title 11, United States Code, includes adding payments to victims of a natural disaster as part of current monthly income. The definition of a natural disaster is also expanded to include situations similar to a major disaster as defined in the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act. The term 'natural disaster zone' refers to the geographical area affected by a natural disaster, as defined by State law. A 'victim of a natural disaster' is someone whose financial situation is significantly harmed by a natural disaster, and whose residence or assets in the United States are impacted. Assets in the United States located in a natural disaster zone before the event that caused the disaster. Amendment to Section 109(h)(4) of title 11, United States Code, includes "natural disaster" as a qualifying factor for debtors. AMENDMENTS TO CHAPTER 3, 5, AND 7: Section 362(b)(22) of title 11, United States Code, is amended to exclude debtors who are victims of natural disasters. Section 521 is amended to allow the court to extend time periods for debtors affected by natural disasters. SEC. 6. AMENDMENTS TO CHAPTER 7 include allowing debtor's monthly expenses to cover necessary expenses from natural disasters and preventing case dismissal or conversion for debtors affected by natural disasters. Section 1112(b) of title 11, United States Code is amended to include natural disasters as circumstances for case conversion. Section 1121(e)(3) is also amended to allow debtors affected by natural disasters to file a plan and extend time for small businesses in Chapter 11. Extension of Time for Small Businesses in Chapter 11 of title 11, United States Code is amended to allow debtors affected by natural disasters to file a plan and extend time for small businesses. Extension of time for small businesses in Chapter 11 of title 11, United States Code is amended to allow the court to extend deadlines in a small business case if necessary to protect creditors and the estate, or warranted by a natural disaster. SEC. 8. AMENDMENTS TO CHAPTER 13 include provisions for extending time periods in cases where the debtor is a victim of a natural disaster. SEC. 9. AMENDMENTS TO TITLE 28, UNITED STATES CODE. SEC. 9. AMENDMENTS TO TITLE 28, UNITED STATES CODE. This section amends Section 1408 of title 28, United States Code to allow cases under title 11 to be commenced in a district court based on natural disaster victim status. SEC. 10. EFFECTIVE DATE; APPLICATION OF AMENDMENTS. The Act and its amendments will be effective on October 18, 2005, and will apply to cases under title 11 of the United States Code starting on October 17, 2005.
